intro: Freirea floridana, commonly known as the Florida freirea, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and hammocks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
